channel.title: Recently Posted Code Samples on MSDN
channel.description: The latest code samples published on MSDN.

item.title: Wonders of Windows Forms: Custom Data Binding
item.description: Michael Weinhardt explores two techniques for turning a single custom type into a genuine list data source using the new data-binding workhorse, the DataConnector.

item.title: Tracing Data Access
item.description: Apply the tracing functionality in ADO.NET 2.0 to track down bugs and bottlenecks in your applications.

item.title: Code Secure: Browsing the Web and Reading E-mail Safely as an Administrator
item.description: Michael Howard discusses how you can run as an administrator and access Internet data safely by dropping unnecessary administrative privileges when using any tool to access the Internet.

item.title: Mobility: Optimize Your Pocket PC Development with the .NET Compact Framework
item.description: Learn the tricks and techniques that increase performance and decrease load time and memory footprints when building applications in the .NET Compact Framework.

item.title: Vrooooom: How .NET and C# Drove an Entry in the DARPA Grand Challenge
item.description: How .NET and C# Drove an Entry in the DARPA Grand Challenge

item.title: .NET Internals: Tailor Your Application by Building a Custom Forms Designer with .NET
item.description: Tailor Your Application by Building a Custom Forms Designer with .NET

item.title: .NET Code Tuning: Make Your Apps Fly with the New Enterprise Performance Tool
item.description: Make Your Apps Fly with the New Enterprise Performance Tool

item.title: Data Points: Efficient Coding With Strongly Typed DataSets
item.description: Efficient Coding With Strongly Typed DataSets

item.title: Service Station: Run ASMX Without IIS
item.description: Service Station: Run ASMX Without IIS

item.title: .NET Matters: Asynchronous HttpWebRequests, Interface Implementation, and More
item.description: Asynchronous HttpWebRequests, Interface Implementation, and More

item.title: C++ Q&A: Deleting Managed Objects, Wrapping a Library, and More
item.description: Deleting Managed Objects, Wrapping a Library, and More

item.title: Building a Professional Stock Allocation System Using Visual Studio Tools for Office, Version 2003
item.description: Learn how to work more efficiently by merging the rich user experience provided by Office 2003 with the enterprise-level development tools provided by Visual Studio 2003 and the .NET Framework 1.1.

item.title: Hosting a Native Windows Control within a Microsoft .NET Compact Framework Forms Control
item.description: Learn how to use a native Windows control in a custom .NET Compact Framework control to support two-way communication so events can be raised following user interaction.

item.title: Games Programming with Cheese: Part Four
item.description: Learn how to deploy a game on a Smartphone device using the .NET Compact Framework and Visual Studio 2003.

item.title: Migrating eVB Forms to Visual Basic .NET
item.description: Learn how to port the GUI part of an eMbedded Visual Basic application to .NET Compact Framework, using Visual Basic .NET.

item.title: Creating an Estimate Solution Using Visual Studio Tools for Office, Version 2005
item.description: Learn about a basic order entry system that uses Excel 2003 for data entry, calculation, and charting capabilities, and Word 2003 for the generation of a report.

item.title: New DataSet Features in ADO.NET 2.0
item.description: Get performance enhancements and improved functionality in the .NET Framework 2.0 DataSet class, and in the closely related DataTable and DataView classes.

item.title: Microsoft Office Outlook 2003 Inside Out: Companion CD Content: Using VBA in Outlook
item.description: Jim Boyce, author of the book Microsoft Office Outlook 2003 Inside Out, introduces you to the VBA environment and provides examples of simple ways to use VBA within Outlook 2003 to automate common tasks.

item.title: Programming with the MapPoint Web Service Customer Data Service Download Methods
item.description: Learn how to program with the new Customer Data Service download methods to download your custom point-of-interest data from the MapPoint Web Service Customer Services Site (CSS).

item.title: Changing Screen Orientation Programmatically
item.description: Learn how to programmatically change orientation, resolution, and other aspects of Tablet PCs. The corresponding sample is written in C#.

item.title: Using HTTP Modules and Handlers to Create Pluggable ASP.NET Components
item.description: Scott Mitchell and Atif Aziz show how to use HTTP modules and handlers to add error logging to your ASP.NET applications.

item.title: MapPoint Get MSAs Add-In
item.description: Learn how to create a MapPoint add-in by using the MapPoint object model and Microsoft Visual Basic .NET. The sample add-in can be used as-is or modified to suit your business needs.

item.title: Longhorn Foghorn: More Avalon Data Binding Craziness
item.description: Chris Sells adds style selectors into the existing data-binding mix with his Solitaire app.

item.title: ASP.NET 2.0 Localization Features: A Fresh Approach to Localizing Web Applications
item.description: Creating global Web applications with Microsoft ASP.NET is becoming more and more important. ASP.NET 2.0 makes it even easier to provide support for multiple cultures and locales through improved runtime and tool support.

item.title: Dynamic Creation of Validation Controls
item.description: Use an XML configuration file to control the dynamic creation of ASP.NET validation controls that are automatically applied to user input controls.

item.title: App Lockdown: Defend Your Apps and Critical User Info with Defensive Coding Techniques
item.description: Protect all your sensitive data to avert disaster.

item.title: Cryptography: Employ Strong Encryption in Your Apps with Our CryptoUtility Component
item.description: Protect your most important data with a custon cyptographic utility

item.title: Trustworthy Code: Exchange Data More Securely with XML Signatures and Encryption
item.description: Understand XML Signature and XML Encryption standards and learn how to use them with .NET for more secure data exchange.

item.title: Data Points: Updating Data in Linked Servers, Information Schema Views, and More
item.description: Updating Data in Linked Servers, Information Schema Views, and More

item.title: Test Run: API Test Automation in .NET
item.description: API Test Automation in .NET

item.title: Advanced Basics: Digital Grandma
item.description: Duncan shows you how to build a client application that pulls down new images from a web server onto his mother's machine to give her the functionality of a 'digital photo frame'.

item.title: Cutting Edge: The ASP.NET 2.0 Wizard Control
item.description: The ASP.NET 2.0 Wizard Control

item.title: .NET Matters: ThreadPoolPriority, and MethodImplAttribute
item.description: ThreadPoolPriority, and MethodImplAttribute

item.title: C++ Q&A: Calling Virtual Functions, Persisting View State, POD Type
item.description: Calling Virtual Functions, Persisting View State, POD Type

item.title: Tablet PC: Add Support for Digital Ink to Your Windows Applications
item.description: Paul Yao takes you on a tour of everything you need to know to get started programming with digital ink, including Ink Input functions, Ink types, and more.

item.title: Business Protocols: Implementing A Customer Complaint System
item.description: Learn to apply Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) principles to business interactions by applying a communication service pattern using Microsoft BizTalk Server 2004.

item.title: Building an Excel Invoice Application Using Visual Studio Tools for Office, Version 2005
item.description: Read this article for a demonstration of an Excel invoice solution written in Visual C# using Visual Studio Tools for the Microsoft Office System, Version 2005 Beta 1, and Visual Studio, Version 2005 Beta 1.

item.title: An Introduction to "WinFS" Opath
item.description: WinFS introduces a query language that supports searching the information stored in WinFS called WinFS OPath. WinFS OPath combines the best of the SQL language with the best of XML style languages and the best of CLR programming.

item.title: Building a Status Report Application with Visual Studio Tools for Office, Version 2005
item.description: Create a Word status report solution that supports schema-based programming and the actions pane in Visual C# using Visual Studio Tools for Office 2005, Beta 1.

item.title: A DetailsView Control for ASP.NET 1.x
item.description: Experience ASP.NET 2.0-like ease of development when building master/details views with ASP.NET 1.x with Dino Esposito's custom control.

item.title: Working with the C# 2.0 Command Line Compiler
item.description: This article introduces a number of compiler options unique to C# 2.0, such as the extended /reference flag and strong name support.
